channel.title: Delay with midi sync, tap tempo, deep modulation
channel.description: Hi all, I've been busy working on some new objects and thought I'd share this. Objects are a work in progress, but close. This patch is stable. It's a modulated, synced delay. No clicks, but you might get some pitch drift if your clock is unstable. Delay time can be synced to midi or tap tempo, with a knob running through straight and dotted divisions. So, 1 bar, *1/2 bar, 1/2 bar, *1/4 bar, 1/4 bar, etc, etc. Or, can run unsynced. Modulation is from a multi wave lfo (triangle, sine, square, saw). There is a pulse width control that affects all wave shapes. The lfo can be synced to tap/midi with a similar division knob set up, or be unsynced. There's also a sample and hold mode on the lfo - it runs synced to midi/tap, at a separate division to the lfo. It holds whatever the lfo is doing, but at it's own division. If you turn the lfo/modulation division knob to max it produces noise, and the sample and hold becomes random. The modulation depth is controlled by a bipolar knob, and it's scaled according to the delay time. The over all range of the depth knob can be increased/decreased with a few buttons, going from subtle to crazy. It has a low pass filter in the delay feedback path because it sounds nice. Here's some screenshots: And here's some patches, they are all the same patch, just with different dial settings kristen kbeat delay subtle.axp (56.7 KB) kristen kbeat delay chorusy.axp (56.7 KB) kristen kbeat delay drastic.axp (56.7 KB) kristen kbeat delay spitty.axp (56.7 KB) kristen kbeat delay twisted.axp (56.7 KB) Enjoy!

item.title: Delay with midi sync, tap tempo, deep modulation
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Hi all,

I've been busy working on some new objects and thought I'd share this. Objects are a work in progress, but close. This patch is stable.

It's a modulated, synced delay. No clicks, but you might get some pitch drift if your clock is unstable.

Delay time can be synced to midi or tap tempo, with a knob running through straight and dotted divisions. So, 1 bar, *1/2 bar, 1/2 bar, *1/4 bar, 1/4 bar, etc, etc. Or, can run unsynced.

Modulation is from a multi wave lfo (triangle, sine, square, saw). There is a pulse width control that affects all wave shapes. The lfo can be synced to tap/midi with a similar division knob set up, or be unsynced.

There's also a sample and hold mode on the lfo - it runs synced to midi/tap, at a separate division to the lfo. It holds whatever the lfo is doing, but at it's own division. If you turn the lfo/modulation division knob to max it produces noise, and the sample and hold becomes random.

The modulation depth is controlled by a bipolar knob, and it's scaled according to the delay time. The over all range of the depth knob can be increased/decreased with a few buttons, going from subtle to crazy.

It has a low pass filter in the delay feedback path because it sounds nice.

Here's some screenshots:

1.JPG1599x773 206 KB

2.JPG1599x813 135 KB

3.JPG1530x208 39.3 KB

And here's some patches, they are all the same patch, just with different dial settings

kristen kbeat delay subtle.axp (56.7 KB)
kristen kbeat delay chorusy.axp (56.7 KB)
kristen kbeat delay drastic.axp (56.7 KB)
kristen kbeat delay spitty.axp (56.7 KB)
kristen kbeat delay twisted.axp (56.7 KB)

Enjoy!
